headline: States Move to Restrict or Protect Abortion Rights After Leak of Draft Opinion Overturning Roe v. Wade
author: Jennifer Calfas
sentences:

Top Democratic lawmakers in New York and California, meanwhile, said they would push to amend their state constitutions to cement existing laws that protect abortion rights.

Some 22 states, including Texas and Michigan, already have laws on the books that could ban most abortions if Roe v. Wade is overturned, according to the Guttmacher Institute, a policy group that supports abortion rights and tracks national abortion statistics.

The first time voters are poised to weigh in on abortion after the Supreme Court issues its decision will be in Kansas this summer, where there is a proposed amendment to the state constitution to specify that it doesnt protect abortion as a right.

Should the Supreme Court overturn Roe v. Wade, abortion-rights groups say they will push for more state-level protections and have been planning for this possibility.

State political leaders across the country proposed new laws and staked out positions as a leak of a draft opinion indicated the Supreme Court could soon overturn Roe v. Wade, which would make the legality of abortions a state issue.

Abortion clinics in states that have moved to protect abortion rights have been anticipating an influx of patients should Roe be overturned, bolstering their operations and making plans for potential outcomes from the Supreme Court.
